akn:subsection.akn:heading: Employees engaged in commerce; home workers in Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands; employees in American Samoa; seamen on American vessels; agricultural employees

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Employees engaged in commerce; home workers in Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands; employees in American Samoa; seamen on American vessels; agricultural employees Every employer shall pay to each of his employees who in any workweek is engaged in commerce or in the production of goods for commerce, or is employed in an enterprise engaged in commerce or in the production of goods for commerce, wages at the following rates:

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Additional applicability to employees pursuant to subsequent amendatory provisions

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Additional applicability to employees pursuant to subsequent amendatory provisions Every employer shall pay to each of his employees (other than an employee to whom subsection (a)(5) 11 See References in Text note below. applies) who in any workweek is engaged in commerce or in the production of goods for commerce, or is employed in an enterprise engaged in commerce or in the production of goods for commerce, and who in such workweek is brought within the purview of this section by the amendments made to this chapter by the Fair Labor Standards Amendments of 1966, title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 [20 U.S.C. 1681 et seq.], or the Fair Labor Standards Amendments of 1974, wages at the following rate: Effective after December 31, 1977, not less than the minimum wage rate in effect under subsection (a)(1).

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Repealed. Pub. L. 104–188, [title II], § 2104(c), Aug. 20, 1996, 110 Stat. 1929
Employees of employers providing contract services to United States

akn:content.akn:p: (e) Employees of employers providing contract services to United States
(f) Employees in domestic service Any employee— shall be paid wages for such employment in such workweek at a rate not less than the wage rate in effect under subsection (b).
